comment.author: 43854658@N00
comment._content:
The Sphinx at Gallipoli – Then and Now (94 years later) Almost a century later, The Sphinx looks down on hallowed ground. The panels along the memorial wall show maps of the campaign as well as quotes from soldiers and political leaders.
“I am prepared for death and hope that God will have forgiven me all my sins.” — Lieutenant Colonel William Malone, New Zealand soldier, in a letter to his wife before he was killed defending the position his battalion had seized on the summit of Chunuk Bair.
A large memorial cemetery[1] is also located here.   “Memorial facing the Sphinx (2009)” by Brian Searwar   “The Sphinx (1915)”      by National Library NZ
